abstract.p: Dave Magee will attempt to win Hambletonian driving undefeated Dreamaster (S)

block.p: Even though he has driven 8,493 winners, Dave Magee has never had a horse fast enough to compete in the Hambletonian. As the pilot of Dreamaster, the early-line favorite, Magee will try to capture the ultimate event in harness racing in his first attempt on Saturday afternoon at the Meadowlands.
''I'm really excited about this,'' Magee said at the draw for the post positions, where his horse was assigned the No. 3 spot. ''I've been dreaming about this ever since I was a little boy.''

''I'm really excited about this,'' Magee said at the draw for the post positions, where his horse was assigned the No. 3 spot. ''I've been dreaming about this ever since I was a little boy.''

Dreamaster is the season's only unbeaten horse and heads the field of 10 in the 75th edition of the $1 million Hambletonian, the richest event in harness racing. He has won all six starts, but at 3-1 odds, he is not considered an overwhelming favorite. In all but one of the last seven Hambletonians, the favorite for the final went off at odds lower than even money.

After Dreamaster, the second choice is Uhadadream at 7-2, with Yankee Paco the third choice at 4-1. Legendary Lover K, who finished second to Dreamaster in the eliminations, is the fourth choice at 6-1.
